channel.title: How to make a public server?
channel.description: Hello I've been here with a problem. So I filled my time with coding the server. But I'm almost finished and I just want to know now how I can bring a server online. And if it is free. Can someone give me a good and clear answer to that? You can be rewarded ingame when the server comes online! ;D

just google… like for real if you see error code at all now google…

Read full topic

item.title: How to make a public server?
item.dc:creator: @thurstyfight thurstyfight
item.description:
@thurstyfight wrote:

That is the point that I do not quite understand. Is there any easier?
As Hamachi (I do not understand) … or just download a client ip address manually and then they can log on to my server. Is there such a thing?

Read full topic
item.source: How to make a public server?

item.title: How to make a public server?
item.dc:creator: @winslow winslow
item.description:
@winslow wrote:

Port forwarding is not too hard make sure ports are open on both your router and windows firewall (that will make your server public)

Read full topic
item.source: How to make a public server?

item.title: How to make a public server?
item.dc:creator: @DevotionPk DevotionPk
item.description:
@DevotionPk wrote:

[FREE] (Your pc has to be on for 24/7)
Portforwarding in your router
Or ( I dont recommand this) portforward with utorrent.

[NOT FREE] (You can turn of your pc)
Buy a VPS, so an other pc is hosting your server.

Read full topic
item.source: How to make a public server?
